item.title: Postgresql: Create New User/Database
item.description: Login as postgresql root user: sudo -u postgres psql If you dont want to use root, use: psql -U username -d dbname -h your_host Create New user: CREATE USER your_new_username WITH ENCRYPTED PASSWORD 'your_password'; Create Database: CREATE DATABASE your_new_database; Grant privileges GRANT ALL PRIVILEGES ON DATABASE your_new_database TO your_new_username; To check if user is created: SELECT * FROM pg_user; Detailed explanations on users: https://www.strongdm.com/blog/postgres-create-user

item.title: Postgresql: Whitelist IP
item.description: Edit pg_hba.conf file located in /etc/postgresql/{version}/main/pg_hba.conf. Example entry to allow IP Address 10.20.30.40 to connect to test database host test test 10.20.30.40/32 md5 Restart postgresql: sudo service postgresql restart Check if server is running and accepting connections: pg_isready
